Class SimulationsScreen

java.lang.Object
ui.SimulationsScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
Screen
public class SimulationsScreen extends Object implements Screen
The SimulationsScreen class represents the simulations menu of the Stock Analyzer application with enhanced UI: stock-themed background image, animated gradient overlay, hover scaling, pill-shaped buttons, and emojis.
See Also:

  • Screen

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulationsScreen

      public SimulationsScreen(DrawingSurface surface)
      Constructs a SimulationsScreen with specified drawing surface.

      Initializes button bounding rectangles for:

      • Investment Simulation Screen navigation button
      • Day Trading Simulation Screen navigation button
      • Exit button
      Also sets the background gradient colors and accent color used for UI elements.
      Parameters:
      surface - The DrawingSurface used for rendering the screen and colors.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Initializes the screen. Currently, no specific setup is required for this screen.
      Specified by:
      setup in interface Screen

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Renders the simulations screen, including:
      1. An animated background gradient
      2. A semi-transparent stock-themed background image overlay
      3. User interface elements with buttons for navigation:
        • Investment Simulation
        • Day Trading Simulations
        • Exit
      4. A click-flash overlay effect for visual feedback on mouse clicks
      This method is called continuously to update the screen visuals.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Screen

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed()
      Handles mouse press events on the main menu screen.

      Detects if the mouse click is within any of the menu buttons and performs the associated action:

      • If the Investment Simulation button is clicked, switches to the investment simulation screen (screen ID 6) and triggers the simulation screen's updateFirst() method.
      • If the Day Trading Simulation button is clicked, switches to the day trading simulation screen (screen ID 7) and triggers the day trading screen's updateFirst() method.
      • If the Exit button is clicked, switches to the main menu screen (screen ID 8).

      Also triggers a click flash effect for visual feedback.

      Specified by:
      mousePressed in interface Screen

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      Handles key press events. If the user presses '1', '2', or '3', the corresponding screen is switched or the program exits.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface Screen

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased()
      Description copied from interface: Screen
      Handles the key release event. This method is called when the user releases a key. This method can be used to reset or update the state of the screen based on key releases.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface Screen
